You don't need a sign, or more information, just listen up! :-) You will never go wrong booking one of Tammy's Airbnbs, and you will NOT be disappointed whatsoever. From the moment you walk in, the space is entirely pleasant to the senses. There aren't any strange smells or peculiar candle scents—just an overall pleasant and clean-smelling scent and sensation as you enter. What's more, do you know that good, warm and cozy feeling you get when something is clean? I mean, really clean? You get that, too. It doesn't just look clean, it IS clean and it FEELS clean. Tammy's Airbnbs provides everything you need or want for those desiring a shorter stay, and it's even fully equipped for those looking for a longer stay. The bedrooms are equipped with the famous Serta and/or Nectar mattresses, respectively, as well as a lot of thought and attention to detail being put into the furnishings, decor, and overall style of the spaces. The entire place is inviting, welcoming, and you're tempted to never leave; never get out. Check-in is a breeze, parking is super easy—2 dedicated spaces—and there's even a back patio setup for grilling and hanging outside; day or night! There is no cable tv, but that's NOT a detriment! There's more to life and getaways than surfing meaningless tv channels. Besides, who needs cable when you have NETFLIX and the ability to stream your favorite content through all the various streaming channels? Just turn the tv on, find the app you're looking for, sign in and you're good to go! One could go on about the space, but the host...! Wow. Just wow. They don't make 'em like Tammy anymore and truly, she is a precious gem of a host. If there's anything you need, she's there. She is so welcoming, so friendly, so kind, so considerate, and extremely gracious. There is a reason Airbnb has dubbed her a "SUPER HOST." So, what are you doing still reading my review?! Get yourself to booking! :-) :-)

It has an electronic door lock which made things very simple. Once inside, there is a living room with a nice TV and cable and a comfy sofa for relaxing after a day visiting Sedalia. There is a kitchen stocked with dishes and pots and pans and utensils. There's a laundry room and an awesome little back yard with a grill and patio set. The bathroom is nice with natural light and plenty of space for putting your toiletries. They provided some shampoo, body wash, hand soap and toothpaste (but we had already brought our own). The bedroom has a nice large closet and the bed is soft with plenty of pillows and blankets. We will book the Meyer House again if we go to Sedalia. Very impressed. The thought put into the little things really separates this place from the rest.
Things like a binder containing local dining suggestions and carry out menus, board games, toiletries and an array of kitchen utensils down to a pizza cutter display a level of thoughtfulness and care you simply aren't going to find many places. It really seems like they've thought of everything that a guest may need and made it readily availible, just in case.
The the home itself is lovely. Large living room, ample kitchen and a furnished back yard with a privacy fence that's absolutely perfect for those who like to unwind outdoors.
Lastly, I was very surprised to find there was a garage. We didn't end up using it this trip but the fact it's even an option and not cluttered with stuff (like others I've seen) is very impressive and should appeal to anyone interested in staying during inclimate weather.
5 stars. Anytime I'm in Sedalia; I know where I'll be staying.

review_text:
We stayed at Chelsea & John’s Place in Sedalia for a week. The apartment is cute and was described accurately. There is air conditioning which kept us cool during a heat advisory period (98-99°F all week - see tips below). The entire place is very, very clean, and we enjoyed our stay immensely. There is street parking directly in front which had space the entire week. There’s also a free parking lot directly across the street. The apartment is situated in old/Historic Sedalia which is walking distance of coffee shops, restaurants, bars, the court house, a CVS pharmacy, and an urgent care. We walked to coffee every morning 1 block away and to dinner 2 blocks away at a good restaurant & bar.
The host was very quickly responsive to my messages and the check in and check out processes were easy. I will definitely recommend this place to anyone who wants to stay in Sedalia.
Description and my impressions:
You walk in and go up a flight of stairs (see tips below) into the main room. There lies a kitchen with an island where you’ll find the glasses and plates etc, a sink, electric oven/stove, microwave and fridge. Off that is the main/sitting room with a small TV, couch with pull-out bed, love seat, and round dining room table with 4 chairs. The decor is all antique-shabby-chic.
The bedroom has a queen bed, dresser with mirror, and 2 nightstands. There is a closet with about 7 or so hangers. The bathroom is situated off the bedroom, and you have to walk through the bedroom to get to it (important to note if you are to have someone staying out in the main area on the pull-out couch) and has a shower (shower-head adjusts to different types of spray), tub, single-sink vanity, and toilet. There were extra towels and toilet paper under the sink. There is a laundry room with washer and dryer off the bathroom with laundry liquid detergent and fabric softener sheets.
Tips for future guests:
- There is a long, steep flight of stairs from the front door to the apartment. The door at the bottom (entry door) is completely clear glass and there is no covering, and opens up onto a main (sometimes busy) sidewalk and street. Soooo make sure to wear clothing, or a robe or something stepping out of the bedroom, as you will be in clear line of sight of the front door downstairs :D
- Bedroom: there is a window air conditioning unit which works very well — as long as the long curtain is not covering it, at which point you don’t get the full effect of the airflow. The curtain is on the rod with those rod rings with clips on them, and I just doubled the curtain up and clipped the ends up. That helped to not be blinded by morning sunlight, which is what happened the first morning when I just left the curtain pulled back/open.
- The air conditioning units (one in the main room and one in the bedroom) are FANTASTIC and kept the apartment entirely cool, even in the 98° temps. They both have vents which can be moved so the air can blow at different angles, which may be necessary dependent on where you sit in the main room.
- The fridge doesn’t have an ice maker but the hosts were very thoughtful and had lots of ice prepared in trays.
- There is no dishwasher but there is dish soap and a sponge.
